pageContext.description: There is a hole 5mm wide and 7mm deep in septum at stop.
pageContext.patina: Grey green patina with golden metal showing.
pageContext.composition: Bronze: Copper 82.6; Tin 11.8; Iron trace; Lead 4.9; Silver 0.04; Total 99.37; Analysis by Prof. C.O. Bannister, 1925.
pageContext.publications: Proc. Soc. Ant. V (2) 431-2 (8 objects shown),At the Exhibition of Shropshire Antiquities 1898, 3 celts from Battlefield were lent by Shrewsbury Museum (No. J. 35),Shrops. Arch. Trans. X 2nd Series p.108.,Only 2 celts are labelled as from Battlefield: these were presented by Mr. T. Beacall (Shrops. Arch. Trans. III [3rd S] p. xxii.). Preb. T. Anden in his History of Prehistoric Antiqs. of Shrops, Voc. Co. His. I, p. 202 mentions 3 Bronze Celts from Battlefield. This is presumably the third.
pageContext.site: England, shropshire,battlefield (almost certainly),probably found with hoard-1862.
pageContext.remarks: Labelled "No. 35. T. Beacall" This refers to the 1898 Exhibition.
